meanings.definition: Lack of thought or regard for others.
meanings.sent1: Her constant inconsiderations towards her friends hurt their feelings.
meanings.sent2: The inconsiderations of the noisy neighbors kept everyone awake at night.
meanings.sent3: The inconsiderations of the forgetful professor led to some hilarious mix-ups in class.
meanings.sent4: The inconsiderations of the reckless driver almost caused a serious accident.
meanings.sent5: The inconsiderations of the selfish king made him very unpopular among his subjects.

meanings.definition: An act or instance of being thoughtless or careless.
meanings.sent1: The student's inconsiderations in class resulted in poor grades.
meanings.sent2: His inconsiderations while handling delicate equipment caused damage to the machinery.
meanings.sent3: The chef's inconsiderations in the kitchen led to a comical mess of ingredients everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The inconsiderations of the hiker left a trail of litter in the pristine forest.
meanings.sent5: The inconsiderations of the toddler resulted in spilled milk all over the kitchen floor.
